content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    # Regular expression to match Julia code blocks
    julia_code_block = r"```julia\n((?:.|\n)*?)```"m

    # Extract all matches from the markdown document
    matches = match.(julia_code_block, md)

    # Initialize an empty string to hold the extracted code
    extracted_code = ""

    # Loop through each match and append the content to the extracted code
    for match in matches
        # Remove leading and trailing whitespace from the matched group
        code = strip(match.captures[1])

        # Append the code to the extracted code string
        extracted_code *= "\n" * code
    end

    return extracted_code
end
```

This function uses a regular expression to match `julia` code blocks in the markdown document. It then extracts all matches and removes leading and trailing whitespace from each match. Finally, it joins all the code blocks together with a newline character.
